content:
I apologize for the confusion. The italicized characters were a formatting issue and do not affect the meaning of the formula. In the expression f(x1,x2) = (x1)^2 −x1x^2 +(x2)^2 −2x2, the variables x1 and x2 should be represented by regular non-italicized characters.

When entering the formula into Excel, you can use cell references to represent the variables. For example, you can enter the formula in cell B1 as "=A1^2-A1*A2^2+A2^2-2*A2". Here, A1 and A2 represent the values of x1 and x2, respectively, that you want to evaluate the function for.
